details.purpose: To record detailed findings about breast cancer found on microscopic examination.
details.use: To record detailed findings about microscopic examination of tissue related to breast cancer. Use as a component archetype in the context of a suite of archetypes that make up a histopathology report ie OBSERVATION.lab_test.histopathology.
details.misuse: Not designed to be used within any other archetype other than OBSERVATION.lab_test.histopathology.

description.other_contributors: Koray Atalag, University of Auckland, New Zealand
Ian McNicoll, Ocean Informatics, United Kingdom (Editor)
description.other_details:
The Royal College of Pathologists, NHS Cancer Screening Programmes. Pathology Reporting of Breast Disease [Internet]. 2005 Jan ;[cited 2009 Jul 26] Available from: http://www.rcpath.org/resources/pdf/PathologyReportingOfBreastDisease-CORRECTED-lowres.pdf
British Columbia Cancer Agency. Synoptic Report Form for Breast Cancer [Internet]. 2005 Dec 13;[cited 2009 Jul 26 ] Available from: http://www.bccancer.bc.ca/HPI/CancerManagementGuidelines/Breast/Management/SynopticReportForm1of6/default.htm

items.description: Microscopic anatomic pathology findings related to breast cancer.
Mitotic frequency is calculated from the number of mitoses per 10 high-power fields.
Histologic grading of breast cancer.
Nuclear score.
Tubular formation score, representing the extent of tubular formation within invasive carcinoma cells.
Bloom and Richardson Grade of breast cancer, derived from the total score of its components: Mitotic frequency score, Nuclear score and Tubular formation score.
Bloom and Richardson Histology Grade ( with modification by Elston and Ellis) is composed of three components which are combined to produce a calculated Histology Grade.
Findings of the relation of tumour to surgical resection margins.
Finding of non-neoplastic cellular change.
Findings related to microcalcification.
Findings of microcalcification.
A text description of pathology associated with microcalcification.
Findings related to the involvement of tumour in lymph nodes.
Assessments of tumour size.
The size of the invasive aspect of the breast cancer.
The extent of total breast cancer lesion.
A text description of any assessment issues which may confound the accuracy of the Bloom and Richardson histologic grade.
Less than 75% of invasive carcinoma forming tubular or glandular structures.
10-75% of invasive carcinoma forming tubular or glandular structures.
Less than 10% of invasive carcinoma forming tubular or glandular structures.
Total score of 3-5.
Total score of 6 or 7.
Total score of 8 or 9.
Size equivalent to 1.5–2 red blood cell diameters or normal duct epithelial nuclei; Diffuse chromatin; Inconspicuous nucleoli.
Size equivalent to 2–2.5 red blood cell diameters; Coarse chromatin; Infrequent nucleoli and mitoses.
Size > 2.5 red blood cell diameters; Pleomorphic vesicular nuclei; One or more prominent nucleoli; Frequent mitotic figures commonly present.
Findings of non-neoplastic cellular changes.
Finding of atypical lobular hyperplasia.
A text description of finding of lobular neoplasia.
Finding of lobular carcinoma-in-situ.
Findings of lobular neoplasia and variants.
Finding of lobular neoplasia.
Findings related to Paget's disease of the nipple.
Finding of Paget's disease of the nipple.
Findings related to Ductal carcinoma-in-situ (DCIS).
Nuclear score, using the Elston and Ellis modification of the Bloom and Richardson system for grading invasive carcinoma.
Size equivalent to 1.5–2 red blood cell diameters or normal duct epithelial nuclei; Diffuse chromatin; Inconspicuous nucleoli.
Size equivalent to 2–2.5 red blood cell diameters; Coarse chromatin; Infrequent nucleoli and mitoses.
Size > 2.5 red blood cell diameters; Pleomorphic vesicular nuclei; One or more prominent nucleoli; Frequent mitotic figures commonly present.
Findings of tumour necrosis.
Non-comedo type of tumour necrosis is present.
Tumour necrosis is absent or minimal.
Comedo type of tumour necrosis is present.
The Van Nuys Prognostic Index (VNPI).
Nuclear grade 1 or 2 and no necrosis.
Nuclear grade 1 or 2 and necrosis.
Nuclear grade 3 with or without necrosis.
Details of invasive carcinoma at surgical resection margins.
Details of the involvement of tumour in sentinel lymph nodes.
Details of the involvement of tumour in axillary lymph nodes.
Immunohistochemical assays of oestrogen receptor (ER) and progesterone receptor (PR).
Oestrogen Receptor assay (ER).
Oestrogen Receptor assay result.
Oestrogen Receptor assay result is positive.
Oestrogen Receptor assay result is negative.
Oestrogen Receptor assay result is equivocal.
An estimate of the percentage of nuclei stained.
Predominant intensity of staining.
Progesterone Receptor (PR) assay.
Human Oestrogen receptor 2 (HER2) assay.
Predominant intensity of staining is low.
Predominant intensity of staining is intermediate.
Predominant intensity of staining is high.
HER2 immunohistochemistry score.
HER2 In situ hybridisation (ISH) result.
Classical atypical lobular neoplasia is present.
Pleomorphic atypical lobular neoplasia is present.
Details of DCIS (Ductal carcinoma-in-situ) at surgical resection margins.
Details of LCIS (Local carcinoma-in-situ) at surgical resection margins.
Paget's disease of the nipple is present.
Paget's disease of the nipple is absent.
Presence of Paget's disease of the nipple has not been determined.
Microcalcification is present.
Microcalcification is present with no evidence of necrosis.
Microcalcification is present with evidence of necrosis.
Histologic grading of DCIS.
Microcalcification is absent.
Presence of microcalcification has not been determined.
Findings related to architecture of the ductal carcinoma-in-situ.
Findingof the dominant DCIS architectural pattern.
A text description of the architectural pattern.
Solid pattern of ductal carcinoma-in-situ.
Cribriform pattern of ductal carcinoma-in-situ.
Micropapillary pattern of ductal carcinoma-in-situ.
Apocrine pattern of ductal carcinoma-in-situ.
Papillary pattern of ductal carcinoma-in-situ.
The dominant pattern of ductal carcinoma-in-situ has not been determined.
Progesterone Receptor assay result.
Progesterone Receptor assay result is positive.
Progesterone Receptor assay result is negative.
Progesterone Receptor assay result is equivocal.
HER2 Immunohistochemistry result.
HER2 Immunohistochemistry result.
HER2 In situ hybridisation (ISH).
A text comment on HER2 In situ hybridisation (ISH) result.
The HER2 Immunohistochemistry result is positive.
The HER2 Immunohistochemistry result is negative.
The HER2 Immunohistochemistry result is equivocal.
The HER2 In situ hybridisation (ISH) result is positive.
The HER2 In situ hybridisation (ISH) result is negative.
The HER2 In situ hybridisation (ISH) result is equivocal.
Atypical lobular neoplasia is absent.
The presence of atypical lobular neoplasia has not been determined.
Finding of calcification in DCIS tissue.
Calcification with necrosis is present in DCIS tissue.
Calcification without necrosis is present in DCIS tissue.
Calcification is absent from DCIS tissue.
Presence of calcification in DCIS tissue has not been determined.
Details of local invasion into lymphovascular tissue.
Details of local invasion into skin or muscle tissue.
Findings of local tumour invasion.
An estimate of the percentage of nuclei stained.
Predominant intensity of staining.
Predominant intensity of staining is low.
Predominant intensity of staining is intermediate.
Predominant intensity of staining is high.
Classical lobular neoplasia is present.
Pleomorphic lobular neoplasia is present.
Lobular neoplasia is absent.
The presence of lobular hyperplasia has not been determined.
Classical lobular carcinoma-in-situ is present.
Pleomorphic lobular carcinoma-in-situ is present.
Lobular carcinoma-in-situ is absent.
The presence of lobular carcinoma-in-situ has not been determined.
Mitotic frequency score calculated from the mitosis count and the microscopy field diameter via a lookup table.
Low mitotic frequency.
Intermediate mitotic frequency.
High mitotic frequency.

Finding of non-neoplastic change.
Columnar cell changes are present.
Intraductal papilloma is present.
Radial scars are present.
Atypical ductal hyperplasia (ADH) is present.
Non-neoplastic change is absent.
Presence of non-neoplastic changes has not been determined.
